intro: Schuurmansia longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf schuurmansia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Schuurmansia longifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
